content:
Hi, do you know if we have the support of linear map T : E ‚Üí‚Çó[ùïú] F as a Submodule E? (what I mean is the submodule generated by the eigenvector with non zero eigenvalue)
I was nor able to find it, and also not able to define it my self in a nice way

I think it's not clear what you mean. Presumably you don't actually mean eigenvectors since there may not be any, even if T is nonzero. If E is a Hilbert space, you could take the orthogonal complement of the kernel. Is that what you're looking for?
Could you please write the formula for the carrier of the Submodule _ E you're looking for?

You are right, the orthogonal complement of the kernel is what I'm looking for
Thank you
Iv√°n Renison has marked this topic as resolved.
